title: GeoChart Inputs Schema
description: This Schema validator validates the GeoChart Inputs.

title.description: Optionally provide the title of the chart

query.description: Groups information on how the data should be queried in the table source

type.description: Indicates the kind of query to perform - supported values are: 'esriRegular', 'ogcAPIFeatures' and 'json'

url.description: Indicates the url where to fetch the data to build the chart with - supported urls are Esri services, OGC API Features services or urls pointing to a .json file built on the GeoJson format

whereClauses.description: Indicates how to generate the where clause to fetch the correct data in the table source. This is an array to support filtering on more than 1 field. The and logic operator is implicit

field.description: Indicates the field name, in the table source, on which to filter

prefix.description: Indicates the prefix/suffix to use to build the query (useful to support single-quotes when the attribute to query is a string)

valueIs.description: Indicates the value as a literal information (not read from a property name from the datasource)

valueFrom.description: Indicates the property name, in the datasource.sourceItem(!), to use to query the table source (the url)

suffix.description: Indicates the prefix/suffix to use to build the query (useful to support single-quotes when the attribute to query is a string)

orderByField.description: Indicates the property on which to order the results of the data coming from the table source

geochart.description: Groups information on how to build the chart

borderWidth.description: Indicates the thickness of the borders (or lines in the line chart)

useSteps.description: Indicates if the line chart should use steps - supported values are: 'before', 'middle', 'after', false

tension.description: Indicates if the line chart should use tension when drawing the line between the values

xAxis.description: Groups information on the x axis

property.description: Indicates the property name on which to read the information from the table source

type.description: Indicates the type of axis - supported values are: 'linear', 'time', 'timeseries', 'logarithmic', 'category'

label.description: Indicates the text in the user interface that should be shown for the axis

usePalette.description: Indicates if a pre-determined (GeoChart specific) color palette should be used

paletteBackgrounds.description: Indicates the array of rgba color values to use as the palette for background coloring

paletteBorders.description: Indicates the array of rgb color values to use as the palette for border coloring

tooltipSuffix.description: Indicates the suffix to use on for the values when displayed in the tooltip

yAxis.description: Groups information on the y axis

property.description: Indicates the property name on which to read the information from the table source

type.description: Indicates the type of axis - supported values are: 'linear', 'time', 'timeseries', 'logarithmic', 'category'

label.description: Indicates the text in the user interface that should be shown for the axis

usePalette.description: Indicates if a pre-determined (GeoChart specific) color palette should be used

paletteBackgrounds.description: Indicates the array of rgba color values to use as the palette for background coloring

paletteBorders.description: Indicates the array of rgb color values to use as the palette for border coloring

tooltipSuffix.description: Indicates the suffix to use on for the values when displayed in the tooltip

category.description: Indicates how the data from the table source should be categorized (this creates the datasets aka the legend)

property.description: Indicates the property name to use to categorize records

usePalette.description: Indicates if a pre-determined (GeoChart specific) color palette should be used

paletteBackgrounds.description: Indicates the array of rgba color values to use as the palette for background coloring

paletteBorders.description: Indicates the array of rgb color values to use as the palette for border coloring

datasources.description: Groups information on the datasources to build the datasource drop down and the chart

display.description: Indicates the string to be displayed in the drop down

sourceItem.description: Indicates the source item(!) used as reference to query the data from. This property has an object with a property that should equal the property in query.queryOptions.whereClauses.valueFrom

value.description: Indicates the inner value used for the 'sourceItem'

items.description: Indicates the actual items (coming from the table source), associated with the datasources.sourceItem (coming from the origin source), used to build the chart with. When items is already specified/populated, the data isn't fetched via the query.url

ui.description: Indicates what ui elements to show with the chart

xSlider.description: Groups information on the x slider

display.description: Indicates if the slider should be displayed

step.description: Indicates the steps the slider should jump when sliding

min.description: Indicates the minimum value for the slider

max.description: Indicates the maximum value for the slider

ySlider.description: Groups information on the y slider

display.description: Indicates if the slider should be displayed

step.description: Indicates the steps the slider should jump when sliding

min.description: Indicates the minimum value for the slider

max.description: Indicates the maximum value for the slider

stepsSwitcher.description: Indicates if the select drop down to switch the steps on-the-fly is displayed

resetStates.description: Indicates if the button to reset the states is displayed

description.description: Indicates the description text to show at the bottom of the chart

download.description: Indicates if a download button should be displayed

chartjsOptions.description: Iindicates further ChartJS specific options to open the door to further customization when natively supported by ChartJS: https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/general/options.html
